headline.main: Taliban Leader Said to Be Yielding Grip on Stronghold to 2 Once-Powerful Supporters

lead_paragraph: The Taliban leader, Mullah Muhammad Omar, a main target of the American war in Afghanistan, has decided to cede control of his political stronghold in Kandahar to two commanders from the Pashtun ethnic group, the Afghan Islamic Press reported tonight. The retreat would end the seven-year reign of the extremist Islamic group, which gave safe harbor to Osama bin Laden and Al Qaeda.
